name: aws
description: The AWS Command Line Interface is a unified tool to manage your AWS services.

sub-commands.name: ec2
sub-commands.description: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) provides secure and resizable computing capacity in the AWS cloud. Using Amazon EC2 eliminates the need to invest in hardware up front, so you can develop and deploy applications faster.

sub-commands.name: describe-instances
sub-commands.description: Describes the specified instances or all of your instances.

sub-commands.name: allocate-hosts
sub-commands.description: Allocates a Dedicated Host to your account.

sub-commands.name: wait
sub-commands.description: Wait until a particular condition is satisfied. Each subcommand polls an API until the listed requirement is met.

sub-commands.name: image-exists
sub-commands.description: Wait until JMESPath query length(Images[]) > 0 returns True when polling with describe-images.
